page.title: 09Transport in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: The surrounding roads are narrow, twisty and steep in places, but the traffic is not heavy, though it increases in the summer months due to tourists. The roads are badly affected by the snow and ice during the winter but the council leave supplies of salt and grit to enable people to help themselves when stuck as well as ploughing out the roads when the snow falls and gritting them if ice is forcast. Every family owns at least one car, a necessity to get anywhere and most youngsters learn to drive as soon as they are 17 with only a handful of women unable to drive. The only public transport is a Postbus from/to Llandrindod Wells in the afternoon at an impractical time and really only used by tourists for a scenic ride.The nearest railway station is 15m away.
